title: A Military Plane Carrying Five Marines Crashes in Southern California; Condition of the Marines not immediately available after the training accident near Glamis, Calif.
text:
The condition of the Marines wasn't immediately available on Thursday morning. They had been stationed at the Camp Pendleton base in San Diego County, the Marines said.

They were members of Marine Aircraft Group 39, a group within a Marine aviation unit known as the Third Marine Aircraft Wing. Capt. Jordan Thorp, a member of Marine Aircraft Group 39, said it canceled its Thursday flights.

Naval Air Facility El Centro, a military air base in Imperial County, said on Facebook on that fire crews had responded to the crash.

The plane that crashed was an MV-22B Osprey, the Marines said, which is a two-engine aircraft that seats up to 24 troops. It was manufactured by Boeing Co. and Bell Textron. Bell Textron, which makes commercial and military aircraft, said in a statement on Thursday morning that its teams were ready to assist the Marines as needed.

MV-22B Osprey planes have been involved in several fatal Marine crashes. In March, four Marines died in Norway in a crash during a NATO training exercise. Three died in 2017 when the aircraft crashed off Australia, and four Marines died when the plane crashed in North Carolina in 2000.

Write to Alyssa Lukpat at alyssa.lukpat@wsj.com

A Military Plane Carrying Five Marines Crashes in Southern California
